page.title: 10DWELLINGS,ELMLEY CASTLE
page.content: Houses vary from timbered black and white thatched cottages dating from the sixteenth century to property still being built.The older houses are mostly grouped around the centre of the villages near the church.Some are beautifully restored and all are in a good state of repair.In Elmley Castle there are 42 houses pre 1800, 15 built between 1800 and 1900, 29 from 1900 to 1950, 50 from 1950 to 1970 and 59 from 1970 to 1984.New houses both privately and local authority built blend in well and are sited away from the main village streets.Many council houses have now been bought.There is an old Romany family who have camped in the area for forty years.
